title: Community Fruit Tree Planting and Care Guide for Bare Root Trees

tasks.task: Planting a community fruit or nut tree.
subtasks: Digging a hole using a digging fork or shovel.
Ensuring the hole is the appropriate depth (8-12 inches) and width (12 inches).
Breaking up the native soil and placing it back into the hole.
Positioning the tree roots downward to prevent rot and disease.
Soaking bare root trees in water for 6-8 hours prior to planting.
Ensuring the tree is planted at the native soil level, with the collar at ground level.
Suppressing weeds around the tree and removing surrounding grass.
Adding compost and mulch (leaves, wood chips) to improve soil fertility and retain moisture.
Planting support species such as comfrey around the tree.
Protecting the tree from animals (deer, groundhogs, rodents) using hardware cloth or similar.
Watering the tree consistently, especially during dry periods.

tasks.task: Healing in bare root trees temporarily.
subtasks: Digging a trench or hole to cover the tree roots.
Gently placing the bare root trees in the trench or hole.
Covering the trees with soil and firming gently to secure them.
Ensuring the trees are stored in a cool, shaded area until they can be planted.
